intro: Siphanthera gracillima, commonly known as the slender-flowered siphanthera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
